column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information and accurately represent the findings from the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately represents the findings from the reference text and contains less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: Ensure that the evaluation is based on the accurate representation of the findings from the reference text and the absence of false information. If there are any uncertainties or limitations in the summaries, consider the impact on the accuracy of the information provided.
column4:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy and completeness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately represents the findings from the reference text and contains all relevant information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately represents the findings from the reference text and contains all relevant information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: Ensure that the evaluation is based on the accurate representation of the findings from the reference text and the completeness of information provided. If there are any uncertainties or limitations in the summaries, consider the impact on the accuracy and completeness of the information provided.

column6:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy and completeness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately represents the findings from the reference text and contains all relevant information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately represents the findings from the reference text and contains all relevant information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score 1)
B significantly better than A (Score: 2)

Note: Ensure that the evaluation is based on the accurate representation of the findings from the reference text and the completeness of information provided. If there are any uncertainties or limitations in the summaries, consider the impact on the accuracy and completeness of the information provided. If there are any discrepancies in the evaluation, carefully review the summaries to ensure the accuracy of the scoring.

In cases where the model has incorrectly labeled examples, it should carefully consider the specific details and nuances mentioned in the original text to accurately assess the accuracy and completeness of the summaries. If the model has previously mislabeled examples, it should reassess the information provided and ensure that the scoring reflects a comprehensive understanding of the reference text.
